data.title: Birchwood Const.
data.meta_description: At Birchwood Construction Company, we are building a passionate culture for all. Each member of the Birchwood Family is integral to our success. We're a family of empowered brothers and sisters, committed to serving your family. When you work with us, we eagerly embrace each opportunity to expand our family.
data.text:
Tom oversees the business operations. He is passionately committed to building the BCC Family as a means of serving the families whose homes we build. Tom and his wife, Jodi, have raised two sons that are their greatest pride. He is most grateful for watching his two sons turn into young men and the bond between them.

​

An avid golfer who can’t seem to find enough time to play as often as he would like, he loves Northern Michigan because of its natural beauty and sense of community.

​

Best piece of advice: Grip it and rip it!

​

What inspires Tom? "Making a difference in the lives of the people we serve."

Kenny handles customer relations and sales within Birchwood, as well as guiding the field in the finished product. He is often taken aback by the folks he works with and proud of the Birchwood Family he's had a hand in assembling. Being married and a dad to four kids and grandpa to seven grandkids is the best part of his life! Flying and riding motorcycles bring him great joy and peace, and he hopes to pass along these two hobbies to his kids and grandkids one day.

​

Favorite pizza topping: Banana peppers

​

Greatest adventure he's ever taken: Being shipped overseas to a land chosen for me, not by me.

Ryan oversees all of the operations and the field which includes Carpenters, Project Managers, Estimator, and Shop. Ryan is also responsible for quality development for office operations and field. A fourth generation carpenter growing up building homes with his father, he was heavily involved in Building Trades at Petoskey High School. Ryan is a graduate of Michigan State University. He spent the first part of his career in commercial construction in Southeast Michigan. His favorite thing about Birchwood: "Birchwood's Family values are truly amazing and it's what drives us forward." Ryan is married to his wife Becky and they have two boys Dylan and Bradley. They love being back in Northern Michigan and enjoy hunting, fishing, mountain biking, boating, and skiing.

What did you want to be growing up? "An architect, but I quickly realized that was not a path for me."

​

What Ryan is grateful for: "My family. We're all healthy and happy living in northern Michigan - we love it here!"

As BCC's Dream Manager, Tina has the unique opportunity to "love on others" by walking beside our family members through difficult situations, assisting them in overcoming life's challenges and fulfilling their personal and professional aspirations. This role includes management of our BCC family wellness program, as well as the BCC family fund. "Birchwood is more than an employer, it's a family and every member is important to our success."

Tina and her husband Mark, have four grown children. Together they enjoy traveling, boating, and spending time outside with family and friends.

Spirit animal: Koala bear

​

Favorite quote: "In the middle of every difficulty lies opportunity." - Albert Einstein

As his title infers, Bill is responsible for not only creating solutions for challenges across our office operations, but also to drive efficiencies to the benefit of the company and our homeowners. He spent 25+ years working in Fortune 500 companies in a variety of sales, operations, and leadership roles, but bar none working at Birchwood Construction has been the most rewarding. It’s all about the people and the true family culture. And if you need a good dad joke, let him know. He's got a mental rolodex full!

​

Favorite holiday: 4th of July!

​

What inspires Bill? "A competitive spirit to know that I or my "team" gave the best effort toward a goal."

As much as we are in the construction industry, our business is based on people. Our projects are a byproduct of the relationships we build and the friendships we maintain. Jacob's role is to identify and implement strategies based on opportunities to build our business. We monitor project plans to ensure that the sales targets are met, but ultimately our goal is our customers satisfaction. We perform data analysis to track business performance and identify opportunities to grow revenue and develop relationships. Furthermore, we maintain an understanding of industry trends for strategic planning and forecasting.

​

Jacob and his wife have been together for 10 years and have 3 boys Jaxon, Wyatt, and Noah. Originally from Charlevoix, he recently was able to move his family back home after spending the prior 8 years just outside of Lansing. His passions include coaching basketball, hunting, and camping with my family and friends.

​

Best pizza toppings: "MEAT LOVERS, NEXT!"

​

What inspires Jacob? "The passion and drive in my children's eyes."

Andrea joined our family in late 2023 as a CPA with 20 years of experience. She will be leading the Accounting and Finance team at BCC. Her primary focus is strategic planning, financial analysis, and providing financial tools to support the business. She is grateful to join such a wonderful group of kind, professional, and hard-working individuals at BCC.

​

Married to her husband Dave, they reside in Harbor Springs with their two kids, Isla and Kyle, along with their two dogs, Pixel and Allie. During the summer months they enjoy Northern Michigan at their cabin in the UP where they love fishing and and spending time on the boat. The rest of the year, you can find them at hockey arenas and soccer fields throughout Michigan.

​

Best pizza toppings: Pineapple!

​

What she is most proud of: "Putting myself through college."

As a Project Manager, Jeremy oversees several projects, and meeting with homeowners to ensure their vision is carried throughout. His favorite part of the Birchwood Family is that everyone is unified to achieve the same goal! One of his favorite projects was customizing one-of-a-kind arch beams at a new build on Lake Charlevoix.

​

Jeremy resides in Northern Michigan and enjoys spending time with his girlfriend and his children. When he's not building cool sh*t, he enjoys cooking and 80's movies.

​

Spirit animal: Squirrel

​

Best advice: "Always do the right thing and stay true to your beliefs!"

As a project manager for BCC, Jason works closely with our homeowners, building relationships and ensuring their vision is carried throughout.

Prior to joining Birchwood, Jason worked as a finish carpenter for a custom builder in Columbus, Ohio. Jason shares "Birchwood is a wonderful place because of its strong emphasis on craftsmanship and relationships. As a lover of aesthetics, seeing the fine craftsmanship we provide in every home, from framing to finish, is great. Beyond that, Birchwood strives to develop strong, lasting relationships with our clients but also with the entire staff." Jason is married to his wife, Lyndee, whom he has known since 4th grade and they recently welcomed a daughter, Jovial. They live on the East side of the Northern Lower Peninsula and enjoy time outdoors hiking and sightseeing.

​

Favorite holiday: "Christmas! It's a time to celebrate the birth of our Savior and Redeemer. Nothing can top that for me. Plus, it is often celebrated with family time and great food!"

​

Best piece of advice: "Always remain teachable. We all have things to learn and grow in."

Drew joins the BCC Family with 25 years of residential construction experience.

​

"Everything at Birchwood is a team effort and everyone is involved. It's a good feeling to be part of a great group."

​

Married to his wife Jolene, they reside in Topinabee with their three teen kids, an Aussie named Captain and Morgan, their beloved cat.

​​

What inspires Drew?:"Great people, and leaders who are compassionate." ​

​

Greatest adventure he's ever taken: Spot and stalk hunt for wild boar in Arkansas.

Lisa has the privilege to oversee an amazing and talented group of painters. The paint team really loves what they do, and it shows by the quality of work they produce. Leading the paint team is a familiar area, as her dad owned and operated a painting business in Harbor Springs for 30+ years. She was able to work for him in the summers on some beautiful projects throughout Northern Michigan. He taught her how to work hard and doing things right the first time! Lisa says "The BCC family always has your back. From the front office to the team in the field, everyone is always and willing to help in any way possible."

Lisa is married with 3 kids, two dogs, and resides in Pellston. They are an active family and love any outdoor activities including: Boating, hiking, the beach, playing sports in the yard, and biking. Her kids all play multiple sports so most days and weekends she can be found at a gym or a field.

​

Greatest adventure she's taken: Hiking and whale watching in Alaska

​

What inspires Lisa? "My kids! They live life to the fullest without any worry about 'adult' things and I find it to be a breath of fresh air. I try to channel their energy and be more spontaneous and adventurous."

Alex oversees the billing, day-to-day accounting procedures, and a sprinkle of party planning. To Alex, BCC is a unique company in that you don’t feel like just another replaceable employee. She truly feels that this company strives to build strong connections with everyone and do what they can to make their employee’s lives better. Alex and her husband, Jesse, reside in Indian River and hang out with their various pets - Maxx, Kona, Andi, Chowder, Tucky, Apricot, and Delaney. In her free time, she enjoys volunteering for equine based programs.

​

Spirit animal: Whale

​

Best advice: My dad always says “The world doesn’t care about excuses, it cares about results”

From the moment you walk through our door or call the office, you'll hear or see Amber's smile as the first one to greet you. Amber’s daily responsibilities include making a great first impression, maintaining the daily office functions, and accounts payable.

A Northern Michigan native, she loves being surrounded by water and friendly people. Amber resides in Cheboygan with her 2 cats. She comes to life in good weather and enjoys kayaking, hiking, swimming, camping, tending to her garden, and being surrounded by friends and family. She is most grateful for life itself!

​

Spirit Animal: “Fox! I always see them and have since I was a little girl.”

​

Best piece of advice she’s been given: “Don’t give others the responsibility of validating you."

Justin's carpentry career began in high school. He has experience in framing, decking, siding, windows, doors, and intricate finishing details. As Superintendent, Justin now oversees day-to-day operations on the project sites to keep the schedule and quality on track. Justin notes: "I am grateful to those who took the time to teach me my craft over the years and to be part of the Birchwood Family." Justin loves living in Northern Michigan because of his deep family history in the area. He and his wife and daughter live on his ancestors' farm and together they enjoy snowmobiling, taking their dogs for long walks, and the quiet country life.

​

Favorite pizza toppings: "My daughter and I couldn't agree on pizza toppings so we ordered our favorites one day - pepperoni, mushrooms, pineapple, and ham. You have to try it!"

​

What inspires Justin: Exceeding homeowners expectations and building cool sh!t!

Dan has been with Birchwood for 12 years. He really enjoys Birchwood because of the people that work here. Dan and his wife reside in Northern Michigan. His favorite part - summer! When he has the chance he's outside enjoying boating and all that Northern Michigan has to offer.

​

Greatest adventure he's ever taken: "Vacation to Mexico! I truly enjoyed zip-lining, whale watching, and snorkeling."

​

What inspires Dan? "My kids and granddaughter."

Todd works closely with our Project Managers to coordinate builds on projects. Todd truly enjoys that Birchwood is very family oriented. Residing in Northern Michigan with his wife, they have one daughter, a grandson, and a chocolate lab named Chevy. In his free time, he enjoys boating and camping.

​

What is Todd most proud of? "The woman his daughter has become and the mother that she is."

​

Best advice: "Be honest in life and bust your a*s everyday!"

Jimmy thrives on coordinating the daily tasks of building cool sh*t! Prior to accepting a Superintendent role, Jimmy spent many years in carpentry with particular experience doing finish work. Jimmy resides in Boyne City with his wife Melissa, and daughter Audrey. When not building cool sh*t, he enjoys deer hunting and spending time with his family.

​

"Birchwood is a great place because as time goes by, it truly is evolving into a place that really is considered family."

​

What inspires Jimmy?:"Being a good dad."​

​

Best advice: "Anything worth doing, is worth doing right."

Mike is our Facilities Manager and oversees the BCC grounds, buildings, tools, and overall maintenance for the company.

​

A history buff who really loves cookouts, motorcycles, and boating, Mike and his wife Janelle live in Petoskey with their doodle and two cats.

​

He is most grateful that both his kids could find jobs in Northern Michigan, so he can spend time with them and his grandchildren.

​

​Favorite pizza toppings: Pepperoni, onion, and green olives. ​​

Favorite words to live by: "It's not what people say, it's what they mean."
